paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the BRCA2 N372H polymorphism, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

patients.demographics: various ethnicities including Africans and Mixed groups
patients.phenotype: overall cancer risk, specifically associated with ovarian cancer and non-Hodgkin lymphoma

functional_data.summary: The BRCA2 N372H polymorphism may influence transcriptional activation function of BRCA2 protein.

variants.segregation_data: Not explicitly mentioned in the paper.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on meta-analysis of 46 studies.
variants.additional_notes: The association was significant in population-based studies but not in hospital-based studies.
key_quotes: BRCA2 N372H may be a cancer susceptibility polymorphism.

The overall ORs and 95% CIs among all cancer types were as follows: [homozygous model: OR (95% CI) = 1.13 (1.03–1.23), dominant model: OR (95% CI) = 1.07 (1.01–1.13); and recessive model: OR (95% CI) = 1.12 (1.02–1.23)].

tables_processed.table_caption: Summary of studies included in the meta-analysis.
Pooled analysis of BRCA2 N372H variant and overall cancer risk.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the BRCA2 N372H polymorphism.
